author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
I think getting the surprise on testnets is not the worst thing if you don't follow the core dev process closely.
We wish that more protocols would start testing on our devnets, so these issues can be flagged earlier, but its always a tradeoff between core dev's time and app devs time

author: barnabasbusa
content:
https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1425#issuecomment-2785815081
https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/1359248377635799230/1359444895177248818

https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7594#networking
```
Since proof verification is much cheaper than proof computation, and the proof size is negligible compared to cell size, we instead require blob transaction senders to compute the proofs themselves and include them in the EIP-4844 transaction pool wrapper for blob transactions.
```

We have communicated multiple times that fusaka-devnet-3 is spec ready, and any L2 was welcome to start testing on it before it would have break on sepolia. If L2s handle the testnets as "prod" environment, and don't wanna break then they need to start looking into a testing platform - devnets. 
You can't have L2 saying that testnets are "prod" and not test their stuff anywhere. Or if they only want to test their stuff on testnets, then its not a prod platform. Its one or the other, but can't have both. 

However, I agree that we could have had a note somewhere - not hidden in the EIP/discord discussions that this will be a breaking change. Maybe we can have it on forkcast? <@119818938845495298> Its probably not too late still, as we haven't shipped anything to mainnet, and I'm sure there will be some L2s that will be using mainnet as their test platform ðŸ˜„ 

Possibly also we should mention this in the ethereum blog posts going forward (or backwards) https://blog.ethereum.org/2025/09/26/fusaka-testnet-announcement, that for all L2s this is a breaking change. cc <@539495253418180618>. I think we can have a highlighted part on this past post, and also on the post for mainnet that will be coming out soon.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
I am working on a blog post to the ethereum blog in order to communicate this specific change again, since it doesn't seem to have reached the necessary parties.
I do agree that we need to highlight these changes more noteably in the announcements going forward.
And I also hope that L2s and other users of the baselayer will engage in the process more actively
